page.title: 11MILNERFIELD FARM-GILSTEAD
page.content: {The Downs family}have farmed here since 1902.The farm was part of{Sir {Titus Salt's}estate.Today Mr&Mrs Downs have{100acres}with about{100 Friesian {cows.}Each cow gives 20litres of milk In the yard is a grain store, a silo, a milking parlour, a low shed and a dairy.{The day starts at about 6am and {milking is at 7am and again at 4pm. The cows go in, five on each side in stalls in herringbone pattern.Ten at once .Food goes down automaticlly for each cow.The{milking machines}send all the milk into a refrigerated tank.Some is{pasteurised & bottled}at the farm. A tanker collects the rest for a big dairy,for milk,butter or cream.The herd stays indoors in winter and feeds on silage.There are{200 sheep}now but after lambing are grazing at Skipton. The farmer's son David keeps{small {stock(hens&ducks)to sell poultry&eggs.
